0.user_question: Annika brought $8166708 to the town fair. She spent half of it on food and snacks, and an additional $10 for rides. How much, in dollars, is left?

ost_step.3: Subtracting what was spent from the initial sum yields ($8166708 - $4083354).

direct_answer.text: From hint we can see annika spend $(8166708/2)=(4083354)$on food &snack .Total expense including ride$(=4083354+10)=$($4083364$.So remaining balance=(Initial Amount)-total expenses=$(8166708)-(4083364)=$$(4083344)$.

direct_answer.text: Firstly, let's find out how much money Anniki spent on food and snacks which was half of what she initially had i.e., (1/2)x$8166708=$8166708/2=$$4083354$. Finally subtracting this value from initial amount leaves us $(8166708-$4083364)=$$4083344$.
